li.a: Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act

div.div: The Lauderdale County School District's mission is to educate all students so they can become competent contributing members of society. The LCSD is committed to meeting the needs of all students we serve as we prepare them to be productive, contributing members of our community. In this pursuit, we know students must have a passion or a desire for something – whether it’s academics, sports, or the arts. This passion is the driving force that gives them one reason to come to school, and thus, they are more likely to experience success.

h3.a: LCSD Distance Learning: Phase Two Kickoff

div.div: The second phase of the LCSD distance learning initiative is now available, and it includes an electronic device for any 5th through 12th-grade student who needs one.

h3.a: The Military and Family Life Counseling Program

div.div: Mrs. Anita Lee, Military Family Life Counselor, offers a video series that addresses strategies for managing stress and changes at home due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.
It's almost game time! Here's a preview of LCSD E-Sports Game Day. Click below for more information. Good luck, gamers!
Northeast Elementary will soon have a new leader at the helm. Congratulations to Mrs. Anita Wansley for being named as the school's new principal. Click on the attached video for more information.

h3.a: LCSD Third Term Honor Roll Lists

div.div: Congratulations to our LCSD high achievers! Click on the attached file for a complete listing of all Third Term Honor Roll students.
